column5: Dave, Chimo Lodge's Roderick Lake might be a fit. Its about a 20 min. flight from Red Lake with several housekeeping cabins, camp manager, generator but no American plan. Roderick has lake trout, northern and walleye.
Chimo is great for walleye. A few nice portage lakes, and great outposts. At a couple of the northern ones its tough to catch anything under 21". We went there for 30 years. Give it a shot.
Which Chimo lakes in particular were tough to catch <21 inchers.

Take a look at Excellent Adventures & Cat Island Lodge on Trout Lake. Affordable prices, good food, clean rooms, great fishing. New owners have made some great improvements to this lodge. A place you'll return to.(phone 807-222-3791)
Hornby, Culverson, Warwick lakes. They were catch and release. You could only keep what you wanted to eat.

Does anyone know of a real good flyin, that is not just a cabin on a lake, but has a nice lodge that is reasonable priced? I saw on Mattice Lake Flyin they have a home lodge or remote cabins. Anyone been there?
Try Neilsen's on Rowan Lake. Good musky, northern and lakers, but no walleye.

DAVE, CHECK OUT BOOI'S LODGE. WWW.BOOI'S.COM. THIS IS A FLY-IN OUT OF RED LAKE TO AN ISLAND ON TROUT LAKE. CABINS ARE TOP QUALITY AND THE FISHING IS AWESOME. ASK FOR TRACY BOOI. SHE AND HER HUSBAND JIM RUN A GREAT CAMP.
I've heard good things about Boois. Several groups from my area go there. Check out Birch Lake Lodge, too. Same area, nice lodge, very good fishing.
Do those rates come with a camp hooker??? Good god man.
The are usually good about offering discounts, Call Pit or Julie for rates. Aikens is the best fly in lodge. PERIOD!
Check out Rough Rock Lodge on the Winnipeg River Fly-in/Boat-inwww.roughrocklodge.com
discount or not--that is straight out of line. I better wake up to a hummer from pamela anderson for me to pay sh@@ like that.
